intro: Stachys hissarica var. turkestanica, commonly known as the Turkestan betony, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant features square stems and opposite leaves, typical of the mint family. Its flowers are usually purple or blue, arranged in whorled clusters, and bloom in late summer. It is often grown as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
